description: Phase that starts or stops a named process timer, recording the start and stop timestamps and calculating the elapsed time in hours.
intent: Record the duration of a process by timing from a start event to a stop event and capturing the elapsed time.

inputs.Timer Name: Name of the timer to start or stop. Arbitrary string when starting; must match an existing start timer name when stopping.
inputs.Mode: START or STOP to indicate whether to start or stop the timer.
inputs.Allow Edit: Flag indicating if the operator may edit the start or stop timestamps (0: No; 1: Yes).
inputs.Display Format: Format string for displaying elapsed time, matching an entry in the TIME_DISPLAY_FORMAT list.
inputs.UOM: Unit of measure for defining exception limits (must be time‚Äêbased for STOP mode).
inputs.Message Minimum: Minimum elapsed time value to trigger a message (optional).
inputs.Message Maximum: Maximum elapsed time value to trigger a message (optional).
inputs.Comment Minimum: Minimum elapsed time value to require operator comment (optional).
inputs.Comment Maximum: Maximum elapsed time value to require operator comment (optional).
inputs.Report Minimum: Minimum elapsed time value to trigger a report (optional).
inputs.Report Maximum: Maximum elapsed time value to trigger a report (optional).
inputs.Deviation Minimum: Minimum elapsed time value to trigger a deviation (optional).
inputs.Deviation Maximum: Maximum elapsed time value to trigger a deviation (optional).
inputs.BackgroundExec: Flag indicating if this phase should run as a background phase (0: UI; 1: Background).
inputs.UseAutoCompleteBehavior: Must be True to allow automated completion behavior.

outputs.Start Time: Timestamp when the timer was started (recorded in database).
outputs.Stop Time: Timestamp when the timer was stopped (recorded in database).
outputs.Elapsed Time (hours): Calculated elapsed time in hours, stored in an internal recipe variable.

preconditions: In STOP mode, a corresponding START instance for the given Timer Name must already exist.
postconditions: In START mode, a new timer instance with the given name is created and running.
In STOP mode, the timer is stopped, elapsed time is calculated and stored, and exception limits are evaluated.
side_effects: Writes start and stop timestamps to the database; if multiple start instances exist, STOP is applied to the earliest one.
May prompt for exception recording if elapsed time falls outside defined limits.
example_usage: Use RecordProcessTime with Timer Name 'RecipeTimer' and Mode = START at the beginning of a recipe, then later invoke RecordProcessTime with the same Timer Name and Mode = STOP to capture and store the total elapsed time.
